title.narrative: ENGAGED ADOLESCENTS

description.narrative: Adolescents mobilized and with increased knowledge and opportunities to participate in public forums of decision-making processes., which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Communication And Advocacy (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Human Rights Institutions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, engaged citizens, including boys, girls and families, millennials, individual donors and private sector partners, are driving public action for the realization of children's rights.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Adolescents mobilized and with increased knowledge and opportunities to participate in public forums of decision-making processes.

description.narrative: The social mobilization of adolescents during 2021 was maintained online due to the COVID-19 pandemic context in Brazil. A total of 2,023 municipalities enrolled in the UNICEF initiative started the creation of the NUCAs (the local groups of adolescents) mobilizing 9,410 adolescents. U-Report reached 112,083 adolescents and young people receiving information and participating in polls related to their rights. Issues such as digital inclusion, employability, COVID-19 prevention, girls’ empowerment, mental health, and wellbeing were covered in online life skills training activities with 95,581 adolescents and young people. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2022

title.narrative: Percentage of municipalities participating in the municipal Seal that have created a NUCA (Adolescent Citizenship Group) (66815), Percent
